data.title: Date replacement
data.solution:
import sys
import math
import re

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

n = int(input())
for i in range(n):
    text = input()
    new_text = re.sub(r"(\d{2})[-/](\d{2})[-/](\d{4})", r"\3-\2-\1", text)
    
    print(new_text)

# Write an answer using print
# To debug: print("Debug messages...", file=sys.stderr, flush=True)
data.statement: You are given multiple lines of text and you have to find the dates in them and change them. The dates appear in the form dd/mm/yyyy or dd-mm-yyyy. You have to reformat them in the form: yyyy-mm-dd.

testCases.title: 3 dates, 3 lines
testCases.testIn:
3
The first meeting was on 04/03/2022.
The second meeting was on 05-06-2023.
Final approval was given on 31/12/2024.
testCases.testOut:
The first meeting was on 2022-03-04.
The second meeting was on 2023-06-05.
Final approval was given on 2024-12-31.

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
3
First date to remind: 17/09/2019.
Second date to remind: 25-12-2020.
Third date to remind: 01/10/2021.
testCases.testOut:
First date to remind: 2019-09-17.
Second date to remind: 2020-12-25.
Third date to remind: 2021-10-01.

testCases.title: Nothing to change, 2 lines
testCases.testIn:
2
This is a random sentence with no dates.
Just checking if it remains unchanged.
testCases.testOut:
This is a random sentence with no dates.
Just checking if it remains unchanged.

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
2
These are random words and sentences just to see if they remain unchanged.
There is no date here and there.
testCases.testOut:
These are random words and sentences just to see if they remain unchanged.
There is no date here and there.

testCases.title: Many dates, some things to not change, 5 lines
Validator 5
testCases.testIn:
5
This is a test 01/01/2000.
Another date here: 23/05/1995 and also 17-08-2010.
Random text without dates.
12/12/2012 was an important date.
The year 2026 is coming.
testCases.testOut:
This is a test 2000-01-01.
Another date here: 1995-05-23 and also 2010-08-17.
Random text without dates.
2012-12-12 was an important date.
The year 2026 is coming.

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read line:string(256)
write line
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] for the number of lines of text
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> A line of text which may contain zero, one or more dates.
data.outputDescription: <<[[n]] lines:>> The same strings as the input but with the dates reformatted.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given multiple lines of text and you have to find the dates in them and change them. The dates appear in the form dd/mm/yyyy or dd-mm-yyyy. You have to reformat them in the form: yyyy-mm-dd.
Input
Line 1: An integer n for the number of lines of text
Next n lines: A line of text which may contain zero, one or more dates.
Output
n lines: The same strings as the input but with the dates reformatted.
Constraints
Example
Input
1
Today's date is 05/02/2025.
Output
Today's date is 2025-02-05.
